授業目的: The main purpose of this course is to improve and develop students’ English communication skills. This will mainly be achieved through participation in group discussions. The course will follow a functional / topical approach with lessons focusing on functional language use in the context of communicative encounters about a variety of interesting topics. In-class participation will require students to express and share their ideas using functional language and other communication skills in group discussions. In each class, students will be required to participate in extended discussions with their classmates. Preparation activities will help students to think about topics and to use functional language naturally and successfully to express ideas. Students will be encouraged to take ownership of English language learning as a life-long process to enrich their personal and professional experiences through engagement with various language activities in and outside the classroom. In-class communication activities and homework preparation will aim to improve students’ cultural and intercultural awareness. Students will be required to think about and express their ideas from a critical, global perspective through the exploration and discussion of contemporary global, cultural and other topics. Students’ will improve their confidence to use English in a professional capacity by developing the skills to organize and give an effective presentation in English.
到達目標:
• To improve students’ overall communication skills and competence, including fluency and confidence to use English interactively.
• To discuss a single topic with peers in groups for an extended period of time (10 minutes or more).
• To improve and develop students’ use of functional language and essential skills to structure, express, and inquire about ideas.
• To develop and improve students’ ability to be effective speakers and active listeners.
• To improve students’ ability to use strategic skills to promote equal participation and balanced interaction with others.
• To encourage students to take ownership of their language studies through reflective activities, as well as in and out of class exploration of relevant and interesting topics..
• To explore and express ideas about contemporary global, cultural, and other topics of interest through sharing ideas interactively with others.
• To improve students’ ability to successfully interact and collaborate with others through participation in a variety of classroom configurations, including pair and group work.
• To create a comfortable classroom environment for learning, communicating and sharing of ideas.
• To improve and develop students’ critical thinking skills through the exploration and discussion of various contemporary topics.
• To develop students’ ability to successfully give an effective presentation in a professional capacity about a global / cultural topic.
授業方法:
Both simultaneous + two-way and on-demand classes will be conducted to begin the semester. (If the current situation changes, this may change.)
